title: Blocks CE
description: A Minecraft-esque game for the TI 84 CE calculator. In it you can generate natural-looking worlds, place up to 24 different kinds of blocks, keep up to 5 saves, and enjoy real-time shadow effects, transparent water, and a 10 FPS framerate!
author: TheScienceElf

title: Cesium
description:
Very first shell for CE calculators :)

Features:
Running ASM, C, and Basic programs directly, (Un) Archiving, deleting, renaming, and hiding programs
Quick access to a program by typing its first letter (â‰ˆ catalog) Ability to block the [ON] key when running
Basic programs
Support for relocatable shared C and ASM libraries Customizable icons for all file types
___________________________________

Source code: https://github.com/MateoConLechuga/Cesium
author: MateoConLechuga

title: Oiram
description:
Oiram CE : a Mario-like for the TI-84 Plus CE / TI-83 Premium CE!
_________________________

Source code: https://github.com/mateoconlechuga/oiram
Level Editor: https://github.com/mateoconlechuga/oiram-editor
author: MateoConLechuga

title: PacMan CE
description:
Adaptation of the 1980 Pac-Man arcade game for CE range calculators.

Also available on http://www.ticalc.org/archives/files/fileinfo/464/46430.html
author: MateoConLechuga

title: Geometry Dash CE
description:
If you want to play other levels than the basic ones (since there are only 8) do not hesitate to take a look at the Games Levels Geometry Dash category !
In addition, you can create your own level! I refer you to the project topic if you want to do it on a computer or to the integrated level editor topic if you want to do it directly on your calculator!

NEW:
- Creation of the editing mode accessible from the main menu by pressing [Alpha] to edit and [+] to create!
- Improvement of the hitbox
- Correction of minor bugs
- ...

Geometry Dash (The Impossible Game) ported to TI-83 Premium CE and TI-84+CE! Play 8 different levels (Stereo Madness/Back On Track/Polargeist/Dry Out/Base After Base/Can't Let Go/Jumper/Time Machine) and create them using the integrated level editor or the online converter! (see the project and editor presentation topics below)

KEYS:
***** In the menu:
- MODE/DEL/CANCEL: quit
- : choose a level
- ENTER/2NDE: launch the game for the selected level
- ALPHA: Edit the selected level
- +: Create a level
***** In the game:
- 2NDE: Jump
- DEL: Return to the main menu
- CANCEL: Quit the game instantly
- ENTER: Open the pause menu (minimalist)

For the level editor keys, read the README.md file or see the

image in the archive!

This program is licensed under the Creative Commons BY-NC-SA 4.0 license.

Feel free to check out the project progress topic!
https://tiplanet.org/forum/viewtopic.php?f=12&t=19211
And here is the topic for the presentation of the integrated level editor!
https://tiplanet.org/forum/viewtopic.php?f=12&t=23601

The project is also on Github: https://github.com/MathisLav/GeometryDashCE
author: Epharius , Anonymous0
